holidays.name: Watermelon Day
holidays.description: A juicy celebration of one of summer's most refreshing fruits ‚Äì the watermelon! Perfect for picnics, seed-spitting contests, and indulging in that sweet, pink goodness.
holidays.origin: This unofficial food holiday originated as a way to celebrate and enjoy the quintessential summer fruit.
holidays.funFact: Watermelons are over 90% water, making them a delicious way to stay hydrated on hot days!

holidays.name: National Grab Some Nuts Day
holidays.description: A nutty celebration encouraging everyone to enjoy some crunchy, nutritious nuts ‚Äì whether almonds, peanuts, or cashews!
holidays.origin: Started in the United States to promote healthy snacking and awareness of various nuts‚Äô benefits.
holidays.funFact: Despite the name, peanuts are actually legumes, not true nuts!

holidays.name: Swiss Wrestling Festival Day
holidays.description: Celebrates the traditional Swiss sport of Schwingen, a kind of folk wrestling where competitors try to throw each other onto the back.
holidays.origin: Dating back to the 13th century in Switzerland, this day honors the age-old tradition and the festivals held around it.
holidays.funFact: Swiss wrestlers compete in sawdust-filled rings; the winners often earn wreaths made of flowers and cowbells!

holidays.name: National Water Quality Month (Start)
holidays.description: Kicks off a month-long focus on the importance of clean water, protecting watersheds, and awareness about water pollution issues.
holidays.origin: Designated to promote water conservation and quality awareness across communities.
holidays.funFact: Only about 3% of the world's water is freshwater, and an even smaller fraction is accessible for human use!
